trends.description: L1 consensus protocols moving toward sub-second finality with enhanced fault tolerance models
evidence: Solana Alpenglow reduces finality from 12s to 100-150ms (80x improvement)
Agave master branch now accessible for private testing

trends.description: ZK-based validation replacing execution-based validation at Layer 1 - fundamental scalability paradigm shift
evidence: Ethereum L1-zkEVM roadmap with EIP-8025 (Optional Execution Proofs)
Six workstreams active: consensus specs, prover infrastructure, zkVM APIs
zkAttesters can sync in minutes without full EL state
Glamsterdam hard fork mid-2026 for proving windows
counterevidence: 12 GPU requirement raises home validator barriers
Trusted setup requirements for some proof systems

trends.description: Network-level anonymity protocols complementing on-chain privacy for censorship resistance
evidence: BuilderNet integration for permissionless block building
counterevidence: New attack vectors in anonymity protocols

trends.description: Validator client diversity becoming critical infrastructure requirement with production-grade alternatives
evidence: Solana Firedancer achieving 1M+ TPS in testing
FireBAM oracle-based block engine in testing

trends.description: Real-time execution layer emerging as next scaling frontier beyond batch rollups
counterevidence: Sustainability of TPS claims under sustained load needs verification

trends.description: Data availability sampling (DAS) achieving production deployment with measurable impact
evidence: Blob capacity increased from 3 to 6-9 per block

trends.description: Transaction inclusion enforcement mechanisms targeting proposer-builder separation centralization
evidence: FOCIL (Fork-Choice Enforced Inclusion Lists) proposed for Hegota upgrade
Advancing for upcoming Hegota fork (Feb 19 confirmation)
counterevidence: Latency increase from public mempool requirement

trends.description: Protocol governance restructuring for coordinated scaling and security development
evidence: Ethereum Foundation reorganizes into three tracks (Feb 19)
Led by Barnabé Monnot and Matt Garnett
Execution performance + networking + consensus interdependence recognized
Gas limit increase path toward 100M via EIP-7928
counterevidence: Organizational changes may introduce execution delays

high_delta_findings.title: Ethereum L1-zkEVM Validation Revolution (EIP-8025)
high_delta_findings.description: Fundamental shift from re-execution to proof verification at L1. EIP-8025 introduces 'Optional Execution Proofs' where validators can opt into zkAttester mode. Enables syncing in minutes without execution layer state. Six parallel workstreams active. EF dedicated team. Glamsterdam hard fork (mid-2026) critical path for proving windows.

high_delta_findings.title: Flashnet Network-Anonymized Mempools
high_delta_findings.description: Low-latency anonymous broadcast protocol from Flashbots (published Feb 17). Achieves lower latency than TOR/Nym alternatives. Network-level anonymity complements on-chain privacy (Railgun/Privacy Pools). Bridges SUAVE vision toward permissionless block building. Supports account abstraction mempools.

high_delta_findings.title: Solana Alpenglow Consensus Protocol Milestone
high_delta_findings.description: 80x finality improvement: 12s → 100-150ms confirmed. 20%+20% fault tolerance model. Agave master branch now accessible for private cluster testing (major milestone). Vote Account V4 prerequisite landed in Agave 3.1. SIMD-123 fee routing groundwork in progress. Target: Agave 4.1 release Q3 2026.

high_delta_findings.title: MegaETH Real-Time Streaming EVM Mainnet
high_delta_findings.description: Mainnet launched Feb 9, 2026. Verified stress test performance: 35K-55K TPS (source-dependent). Theoretical capacity 100K TPS. 10ms block times achieved. TVL reached $66M within one week. Modular architecture with execution/settlement separation.
